definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to have a heart of stone/hard-hearted/unfeeling
a magnet/same as 磁鐵|磁铁

sentences.english: How long must the iron-hearted monster feed on our life's blood?
sentences.chinese: 這鐵石心腸的怪物吸着我們的血液，還得吸多久呢？

sentences.english: My heart is stone and still it trembles.
sentences.chinese: 我本心如鐵石，卻不由顫抖。

sentences.english: That weaves its spell on even a stone heart?
sentences.chinese: 竟把咒語織進鐵石心腸？

sentences.english: The sad condition of these refugees would move a heart of stone to sympathy。
sentences.chinese: 這些難民的悲慘處境能使一個鐵石心腸動容。

sentences.english: The dampened cloth makes a great dirt magnet.
sentences.chinese: 一般來說，溼布是一塊絕妙的灰塵吸鐵石。

sentences.english: The man has a heart of stone and he will never help anybody.
sentences.chinese: 那個人有副鐵石心腸，他從不幫助任何人。

sentences.english: He has a heart of stone.
She doesn't know the meaning of pity. She has a heart of stone.
sentences.chinese: 看到我這樣的死法，即使鐵石心腸的人也會憐憫你的。

sentences.english: You had my heart of stone, not in the full moon night languish.
sentences.chinese: 你煉就了我的鐵石心腸，不會在月圓的夜苦苦期盼。

sentences.english: These filters are dust and pollen magnets.
sentences.chinese: 這些過濾器是灰塵和花粉的“吸鐵石”。

sentences.english: He has a heart like stone .
sentences.chinese: 他有一顆鐵石一樣的心腸。

sentences.english: He was a despot with a heart of granite.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲湯姆是一個鐵石心腸的人。

sentences.english: His enthusiasm is enough to melt a heart of stone.
sentences.chinese: 他的熱誠足以軟化鐵石心腸。

sentences.english: The sad condition of these refugees would move a heart of stone to sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 這些難民的悲慘處境能使一個鐵石心腸動容。

sentences.english: Coaster has a small magnet can attract the love spoon.
sentences.chinese: 杯墊有小吸鐵石可以吸住勺子。

sentences.english: My boss is so hard-hearted. He gave us only half a day vacation for Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我的老闆真是鐵石心腸，聖誕節只給了我們半天假。

definition: orpiment/arsenic trisulfide As2S3/make changes in writing/malign/criticize without grounds
to pick the edible part of vegetables
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
